questions.text: During the filling phase of the urinary bladder:

options.text: sympathetic tone dominates in the bladder wall.
the bladder volume and intravesical pressure increase in direct proportion.
the inner urethral sphincter relaxes.
the outer urethral sphincter relaxes.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true concerning human urinary bladder function?

options.text: emptying of the bladder during urination can be supported by the simultaneous contractions of abdominal muscles
in the presence of vasopressin, water is reabsorbed through the urothelium of the bladder
activation of the parasympathetic nerves of the bladder contributes to the receptive relaxation of the smooth muscle during bladder filling
the urine storage function is promoted by the Bayliss effect of the bladder smooth muscle
in healthy subjects, there is always some urine retention after urination

questions.text: The autonomic innervation of the urinary bladder involves:

options.text: the activation of nicotinic acetyl-choline receptors by parasympathetic activity
the activation of beta-2 receptors by sympathetic activity
sympathetic nerves exert presynaptic inhibition on parasympathetic terminals
the activation of alfa-1 receptors by sympathetic activity
the activation of muscarinic acetyl-choline receptors by parasympathetic activity

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true concerning human urinary bladder function?

options.text: in the presence of vasopressin, water is reabsorbed through the urothelium of the bladder
emptying of bladder during urination is supported by the simultaneous contraction of the detrusor muscle
the urine storage function is promoted by the Bayliss effect of the bladder smooth muscle
in healthy adults, there is always some urine retention after urination
the inner urethral sphincter voluntarily relaxes
sympathetic tone decreases on the inner urethral sphincter
the outer uretral sphincter voluntarily relaxes
parasympathetic tone decreases on the outer urethral sphincter

questions.text: The parasympathetic preganglionic neuronal cell bodies controlling the detrusor muscle of the bladder are located in the

options.text: hypothalamus
medulla oblongata
lumbar spinal cord
sacral spinal cord

questions.text: The reflex of micturition can never be evoked if the following region is damaged

options.text: midbrain
thoracic spinal cord
pons
sacral spinal cord
lumbal spinal cord
cortex
hypothalamus

questions.text: The parasympathetic preganglionic neuronal cell bodies controlling the detrusor muscle of the bladder are located in the

options.text: lumbar spinal cord
sacral spinal cord
medulla oblongata
hypothalamus
